page.title: 01OVERVIEW
page.content: The area covered by this survey is a rural one. It is situated on the tidal Solway Firth, and the land is flat and fertile. The farms are on the whole fairly prosperous, producing grass crops, beef and dairy cattle, and some sheep. The sparse population centres on the villages of Powfoot and Cummertrees. Most people are employed either in agriculture, or work in the nearby towns of Annan or Dumfries. There is a certain amount of seasonal employment in the tourist industry, which revolves round the golf course at Powfoot. The normal village social activities are still to be found, although due to the declining rural population, and the proximity to Annan, fresh amenities have not developed.
